title: Australia’s best photos of the month – March 2025
description: Cyclone Alfred drives wild seas, a seagull eclipses the moon, and our Kylie performs on a trapeze: Guardian Australia looks at some of the month’s best imagesOf tinkerers and dreamers: striving to be the fastest on the salt on Lake Gairdner Continue reading...
author: Guardian Staff
excerpt: Cyclone Alfred drives wild seas, a seagull eclipses the moon, and our Kylie performs on a trapeze: Guardian Australia looks at some of the month’s best images
text: A protester interrupts treasurer Jim Chalmers’ (right) federal budget preview to the Queensland Media Club in Brisbane on 18 March. Photograph: Jono Searle/AAP Race starter Harry Deree awaits a call from officials at Dry Lakes Racers Australia Speed Week at Lake Gairdner, South Australia. Photograph: Dean Sewell/The Guardian Filling sandbags beside the Big Prawn ahead of cyclonic conditions in Ballina. Photograph: James D Morgan/Getty Images After a close encounter with a great white, Will Salter has become more shark literate. Photograph: Alex Coppel/The Guardian Giant waves at Fingal beach as Tropical Cyclone Alfred approaches the NSW coast. Photograph: Trent Mitchell/The Guardian North Lismore resident Aidan Ricketts navigates the streets in a boat to check on his property. Photograph: Elise Derwin/The Guardian Residents walk along the damaged foreshore of Nobby’s beach as Cyclone Alfred inches towards the Gold Coast. Photograph: David Gray/AFP/Getty Images Young men play in foam generated by rough seas as Cyclone Alfred threatens Coolangatta. Photograph: Dave Hunt/AAP Gumbaynggirr and Wiradjuri actress and playwright Dalara Williams at the Belvoir theatre rehearsing for her production, Big Girls Don’t Cry. Photograph: Bec Lorrimer/The Guardian Liz Lee and Julie Griffin search for recyclable cans and bottles in Bondi to supplement their income via NSW’s Return and Earn scheme. Photograph: Lisa Maree Williams/The Guardian A view of Brisbane from the Mount Coot-tha summit lookout. Photograph: Albert Perez/Getty Images Australia’s iconic beach culture used to feel off-limits to Sarah Malik. She now competes in major ocean swimming races. Photograph: Jessica Hromas/The Guardian Lithuanian Aurimas Mockus falls to his knees sobbing as he is comforted by his wife, Sonata Mockuviene, after being rescued attempting a 12,000km Pacific Ocean crossing from San Diego to Brisbane in his solo rowing boat. Photograph: James Gourley/The Guardian New Zealand singer-songwriter Marlon Williams at Dusty’s cafe in Collingwood before his new album, Te Whare Tīwekaweka, launches in April. Photograph: Ellen Smith/The Guardian Lenine Bourke (right), with children Luca and Arkie, lives with Coonan (left) and his children Bernie, Greg and Ray to save costs and share childcare. Photograph: Jamila Filippone/The Guardian Ramadan is celebrated at Lakemba, Sydney. Photograph: Flavio Brancaleone/AAP Tina Middleton and her teenage son Tyson were homeless for more than a year and lived in their car. They are occupying a room in a government buyback house on Pine Street in North Lismore. Photograph: Elise Derwin/The Guardian Participants pilot water jet packs on the Yarra River during the annual Moomba festival. Photograph: William West/AFP/Getty Images Artist Vincent Fantauzzo in his Melbourne studio. His new memoir, Unveiled, is out now. Photograph: Eugene Hyland/The Guardian Amy Elizabeth dons leopard print for the 47th annual Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras parade on Oxford Street, Sydney. Photograph: Paul Braven/AAP Kylie Minogue perches on a trapeze swing as her Tension Tour visits Sydney. Photograph: Don Arnold/WireImage Topics Photography Sydney Australia weather Protest Climate crisis Oceans The moon
html:

  • Photography
  • Sydney
  • Australia weather
  • Protest
